description: The hosts resource usage dashboard displaying resources usage measurements - number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, and network Tx/Rx

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays resource usage (number of virtual machines, CPU, memory, network Tx/Rx) for a selected host within a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays average number of virtual machines for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average active VMs counts by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Average active vms
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    vms_num AS "Avg. Number of VMs"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( VMS ) AS "vms_num"
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts active vms
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average active VMs counts by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Average active vms
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    vms_num AS "Avg. Number of VMs"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( VMS ) AS "vms_num"
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts active vms
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average Number of Virtual Machines (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays average number of virtual machines peaks for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average active VMs counts by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Max active vms
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    vms_peak AS "Avg. VMs Peak"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS vms_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max active vms
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, active_vms AS max_active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average active VMs counts by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Max active vms
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    vms_peak AS "Avg. VMs Peak"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS vms_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max active vms
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_active_vms, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS VMS_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_active_vms, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime

        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average Number of Virtual Machine Peaks (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average CPU usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Average CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    cpu_usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS cpu_usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts CPU usage percent
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
         -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')       
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average CPU usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Average CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    cpu_usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS cpu_usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts CPU usage percent
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average CPU Usage (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage peaks for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average CPU usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Max CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    cpu_peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( CPU_Peak ) AS cpu_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max CPU usage 
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent AS max_cpu_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average CPU usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Max CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    cpu_peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( CPU_Peak ) AS cpu_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max CPU usage 
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_cpu_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_cpu_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)

            CASE $period_id

                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')

panels.title: Average CPU Usage Peaks (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays average memory usage for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average memory usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Average memory usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( MEM_Usage ) AS mem_usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts memory usage percent
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average memory usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Average memory usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( MEM_Usage ) AS mem_usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts memory usage percent
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average Memory Usage (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays average memory usage peaks for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average memory usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Max memory usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_peak AS "Memory Usage Peaks"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( MEM_Peak ) AS mem_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max memory usage
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                            SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent AS max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                        ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    samples.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND samples.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')         
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns the hosts
-- max and average memory usage peaks by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Max memory usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    mem_peak AS "Memory Usage Peaks"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
            AVG ( MEM_Peak ) AS mem_peak
        FROM 
            (
                -- Here we get the hosts max memory usage
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
                FROM
                        (
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            UNION
                                SELECT history_datetime, max_memory_usage, minutes_in_status, host_status, host_id
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                WHERE
                                    history_datetime <
                                        (
                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        )
                        ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                    hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query
         -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')       
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average Memory Usage Peaks (BR2C)
Host Interface Rx and Tx Usage

panels.description: This report displays for the top 3 most utilized network interfaces the average network interface transmit rate for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- ethernet interface Tx and Rx rates, by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Tx rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
        Tx_rate
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
        AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime AS time,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS statistics
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                                statistics.host_interface_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                            )
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            ( 
                                                c.host_interface_id = 
                                                b.host_interface_id 
                                            )
                                    INNER JOIN
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS e
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                                                AND e.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                                    e.host_status = 1
                                    AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                                ORDER BY
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                        DESC
                                LIMIT 3
                            ) 
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime
            ) AS from_sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')         
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- ethernet interface Tx and Rx rates, by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Tx rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
        Tx_rate
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
        AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime AS time,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS statistics
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                                statistics.host_interface_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                            )
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                            WHERE
                                                history_datetime <
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    )
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            ( 
                                                c.host_interface_id = 
                                                b.host_interface_id 
                                            )
                                    INNER JOIN
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                            WHERE
                                                history_datetime <
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    )
                                    ) AS e
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                                                AND e.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                                    e.host_status = 1
                                    AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                                ORDER BY
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                        DESC
                                LIMIT 3
                            ) 
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime
            ) AS from_sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Top 3 Most Utilized Network Interface - Transmit Rate (BR2C)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 3 most utilized network interfaces the average network interface receive rate for a selected host within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- ethernet interface Tx and Rx rates, by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Rx rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
        Rx_rate
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
        AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime AS time,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent
                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS statistics
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                                statistics.host_interface_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                            )
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            ( 
                                                c.host_interface_id = 
                                                b.host_interface_id 
                                            )
                                    INNER JOIN
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS e
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                                                AND e.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                                    e.host_status = 1
                                    AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                                ORDER BY
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                        DESC
                                LIMIT 3
                            ) 
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime
            ) AS from_sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES') 
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- ethernet interface Tx and Rx rates, by hour of day and day of week

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Rx rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST (num AS int)
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saterday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
        Rx_rate
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num,
        AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime AS time,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS statistics
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                                statistics.host_interface_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id IN ($host_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                            )
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.host_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                            WHERE
                                                history_datetime <
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    )
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            ( 
                                                c.host_interface_id = 
                                                b.host_interface_id 
                                            )
                                    INNER JOIN
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                            WHERE
                                                history_datetime <
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    )
                                    ) AS e
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                e.history_datetime = b.history_datetime
                                                AND e.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                                    e.host_status = 1
                                    AND c.host_id IN ($host_id)
                                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                                ORDER BY
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                        AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                        DESC
                                LIMIT 3
                            ) 
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
                    interface_name,
                    statistics.history_datetime
            ) AS from_sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Top 3 Most Utilized Network Interface - Receive Rate (BR2C)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  								 									) 					) 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  								 									) 					) 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 			        SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 			        SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN host_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				) 	 			AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')  			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN host_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				) 	 			AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')  			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
